Description: Stamp (vessel): quarter-qisṭ. Five line inscription. Piece of rim projecting at top. Made of green glass.
Curator's comments: From the same die: Miles, G.C. 1971. ‘Umayyad and ʿAbbasid glass weights and measure stamps in the Corning Museum’. Corning, 29.
Muʿāwiya's stamps are scarce, so he was presumably only in office a short time.
Bibliographic references: Morton 1985 / A Catalogue of Early Islamic Glass Stamps (234)
